table.name: actions
table.Comment: Stores action information.

table.name: authmap
table.Comment: Stores distributed authentication mapping.

table.name: batch
table.Comment: Stores details about batches (processes that run in...

table.name: block
table.Comment: Stores block settings, such as region and visibility...

table.name: block_custom
table.Comment: Stores contents of custom-made blocks.

table.name: block_node_type
table.Comment: Sets up display criteria for blocks based on content types

table.name: block_role
table.Comment: Sets up access permissions for blocks based on user roles

table.name: blocked_ips
table.Comment: Stores blocked IP addresses.

table.name: cache
table.Comment: Generic cache table for caching things not separated out...

table.name: cache_block
table.Comment: Cache table for the Block module to store already built...

table.name: cache_bootstrap
table.Comment: Cache table for data required to bootstrap Drupal, may be...

table.name: cache_field
table.Comment: Cache table for the Field module to store already built...

table.name: cache_filter
table.Comment: Cache table for the Filter module to store already...

table.name: cache_form
table.Comment: Cache table for the form system to store recently built...

table.name: cache_image
table.Comment: Cache table used to store information about image...

table.name: cache_menu
table.Comment: Cache table for the menu system to store router...

table.name: cache_page
table.Comment: Cache table used to store compressed pages for anonymous...

table.name: cache_path
table.Comment: Cache table for path alias lookup.

table.name: cache_update
table.Comment: Cache table for the Update module to store information...

table.name: cache_views
table.Comment: Generic cache table for caching things not separated out...

table.name: cache_views_data
table.Comment: Cache table for views to store pre-rendered queries,...

table.name: comment
table.Comment: Stores comments and associated data.

table.name: ctools_css_cache
table.Comment: A special cache used to store CSS that must be non-volatile.

table.name: ctools_object_cache
table.Comment: A special cache used to store objects that are being...

table.name: date_format_locale
table.Comment: Stores configured date formats for each locale.

table.name: date_format_type
table.Comment: Stores configured date format types.

table.name: date_formats
table.Comment: Stores configured date formats.

table.name: field_data_body
table.Comment: Data storage for field 2 (body)

table.name: field_data_comment_body
table.Comment: Data storage for field 1 (comment_body)

table.name: field_data_field_first_image
table.Comment: Data storage for field 5 (field_first_image)

table.name: field_data_field_image
table.Comment: Data storage for field 4 (field_image)

table.name: field_data_field_tags
table.Comment: Data storage for field 3 (field_tags)

table.name: field_revision_body
table.Comment: Revision archive storage for field 2 (body)

table.name: field_revision_comment_body
table.Comment: Revision archive storage for field 1 (comment_body)

table.name: field_revision_field_first_image
table.Comment: Revision archive storage for field 5 (field_first_image)

table.name: field_revision_field_image
table.Comment: Revision archive storage for field 4 (field_image)

table.name: field_revision_field_tags
table.Comment: Revision archive storage for field 3 (field_tags)

table.name: file_managed
table.Comment: Stores information for uploaded files.

table.name: file_usage
table.Comment: Track where a file is used.

table.name: filter
table.Comment: Table that maps filters (HTML corrector) to text formats ...

table.name: filter_format
table.Comment: Stores text formats: custom groupings of filters, such as...

table.name: flood
table.Comment: Flood controls the threshold of events, such as the...

table.name: history
table.Comment: A record of which users have read which nodes.

table.name: image_effects
table.Comment: Stores configuration options for image effects.

table.name: image_styles
table.Comment: Stores configuration options for image styles.

table.name: menu_custom
table.Comment: Holds definitions for top-level custom menus (for example...

table.name: menu_links
table.Comment: Contains the individual links within a menu.

table.name: menu_router
table.Comment: Maps paths to various callbacks (access, page and title)

table.name: node
table.Comment: The base table for nodes.

table.name: node_access
table.Comment: Identifies which realm/grant pairs a user must possess in...

table.name: node_comment_statistics
table.Comment: Maintains statistics of node and comments posts to show ...

table.name: node_revision
table.Comment: Stores information about each saved version of a node.

table.name: node_type
table.Comment: Stores information about all defined node types.

table.name: queue
table.Comment: Stores items in queues.

table.name: rdf_mapping
table.Comment: Stores custom RDF mappings for user defined content types...

table.name: registry
table.Comment: Each record is a function, class, or interface name and...

table.name: registry_file
table.Comment: Files parsed to build the registry.

table.name: role
table.Comment: Stores user roles.

table.name: role_permission
table.Comment: Stores the permissions assigned to user roles.

table.name: search_dataset
table.Comment: Stores items that will be searched.

table.name: search_index
table.Comment: Stores the search index, associating words, items and...

table.name: search_node_links
table.Comment: Stores items (like nodes) that link to other nodes, used...

table.name: search_total
table.Comment: Stores search totals for words.

table.name: semaphore
table.Comment: Table for holding semaphores, locks, flags, etc. that...

table.name: sequences
table.Comment: Stores IDs.

table.name: sessions
table.Comment: Drupal’s session handlers read and write into the...

table.name: shortcut_set
table.Comment: Stores information about sets of shortcuts links.

table.name: shortcut_set_users
table.Comment: Maps users to shortcut sets.

table.name: system
table.Comment: A list of all modules, themes, and theme engines that are...

table.name: taxonomy_index
table.Comment: Maintains denormalized information about node/term...

table.name: taxonomy_term_data
table.Comment: Stores term information.

table.name: taxonomy_term_hierarchy
table.Comment: Stores the hierarchical relationship between terms.

table.name: taxonomy_vocabulary
table.Comment: Stores vocabulary information.

table.name: url_alias
table.Comment: A list of URL aliases for Drupal paths; a user may visit...

table.name: users
table.Comment: Stores user data.

table.name: users_roles
table.Comment: Maps users to roles.

table.name: variable
table.Comment: Named variable/value pairs created by Drupal core or any...

table.name: views_display
table.Comment: Stores information about each display attached to a view.

table.name: views_view
table.Comment: Stores the general data for a view.

table.name: watchdog
table.Comment: Table that contains logs of all system events.

column.name: aid
column.Comment: Primary Key: Unique actions ID.

column.name: type
column.Comment: The object that that action acts on (node, user, comment, system or custom types.)

column.name: callback
column.Comment: The callback function that executes when the action runs.

column.name: parameters
column.Comment: Parameters to be passed to the callback function.

column.name: label
column.Comment: Label of the action.

column.name: aid
column.Comment: Primary Key: Unique authmap ID.

column.name: uid
column.Comment: User’s users.uid.

column.name: authname
column.Comment: Unique authentication name.

column.name: module
column.Comment: Module which is controlling the authentication.

column.name: bid
column.Comment: Primary Key: Unique batch ID.

column.name: token
column.Comment: A string token generated against the current user’s session id and the batch id, used to ensure that only the user who submitted the batch can effectively access it.

column.name: timestamp
column.Comment: A Unix timestamp indicating when this batch was submitted for processing. Stale batches are purged at cron time.

column.name: batch
column.Comment: A serialized array containing the processing data for the batch.

column.name: bid
column.Comment: Primary Key: Unique block ID.

column.name: module
column.Comment: The module from which the block originates; for example, ’user’ for the Who’s Online block, and ’block’ for any custom blocks.

column.name: delta
column.Comment: Unique ID for block within a module.

column.name: theme
column.Comment: The theme under which the block settings apply.

column.name: status
column.Comment: Block enabled status. (1 = enabled, 0 = disabled)

column.name: weight
column.Comment: Block weight within region.

column.name: region
column.Comment: Theme region within which the block is set.

column.name: custom
column.Comment: Flag to indicate how users may control visibility of the block. (0 = Users cannot control, 1 = On by default, but can be hidden, 2 = Hidden by default, but can be shown)

column.name: visibility
column.Comment: Flag to indicate how to show blocks on pages. (0 = Show on all pages except listed pages, 1 = Show only on listed pages, 2 = Use custom PHP code to determine visibility)

column.name: pages
column.Comment: Contents of the "Pages" block; contains either a list of paths on which to include/exclude the block or PHP code, depending on "visibility" setting.

column.name: title
column.Comment: Custom title for the block. (Empty string will use block default title, <none> will remove the title, text will cause block to use specified title.)

column.name: cache
column.Comment: Binary flag to indicate block cache mode. (-2: Custom cache, -1: Do not cache, 1: Cache per role, 2: Cache per user, 4: Cache per page, 8: Block cache global) See DRUPAL_CACHE_* constants in ../includes/common.inc for more detailed information.

column.name: bid
column.Comment: The block’s block.bid.

column.name: body
column.Comment: Block contents.

column.name: info
column.Comment: Block description.

column.name: format
column.Comment: The filter_format.format of the block body.

column.name: module
column.Comment: The block’s origin module, from block.module.

column.name: delta
column.Comment: The block’s unique delta within module, from block.delta.

column.name: type
column.Comment: The machine-readable name of this type from node_type.type.

column.name: module
column.Comment: The block’s origin module, from block.module.

column.name: delta
column.Comment: The block’s unique delta within module, from block.delta.

column.name: rid
column.Comment: The user’s role ID from users_roles.rid.

column.name: iid
column.Comment: Primary Key: unique ID for IP addresses.

column.name: ip
column.Comment: IP address

column.name: cid
column.Comment: Primary Key: Unique cache ID.

column.name: data
column.Comment: A collection of data to cache.

column.name: expire
column.Comment: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry should expire, or 0 for never.

column.name: created
column.Comment: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry was created.

column.name: serialized
column.Comment: A flag to indicate whether content is serialized (1) or not (0).

column.Comment: Primary Key: Unique cache ID.

column.name: cid
column.Comment: Primary Key: Unique cache ID.

column.name: data
column.Comment: A collection of data to cache.

column.name: expire
column.Comment: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry should expire, or 0 for never.

column.name: created
column.Comment: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry was created.

column.name: serialized

column.name: cid
column.Comment: Primary Key: Unique comment ID.

column.name: pid
column.Comment: The comment.cid to which this comment is a reply. If set to 0, this comment is not a reply to an existing comment.

column.name: nid
column.Comment: The node.nid to which this comment is a reply.

column.name: uid
column.Comment: The users.uid who authored the comment. If set to 0, this comment was created by an anonymous user.

column.name: subject
column.Comment: The comment title.

column.name: hostname
column.Comment: The author’s host name.

column.name: created
column.Comment: The time that the comment was created, as a Unix timestamp.

column.name: changed
column.Comment: The time that the comment was last edited, as a Unix timestamp.

column.name: status
column.Comment: The published status of a comment. (0 = Not Published, 1 = Published)

column.name: thread
column.Comment: The vancode representation of the comment’s place in a thread.

column.name: name
column.Comment: The comment author’s name. Uses users.name if the user is logged in, otherwise uses the value typed into the comment form.

column.name: mail
column.Comment: The comment author’s e-mail address from the comment form, if user is anonymous, and the ’Anonymous users may/must leave their contact information’ setting is turned on.

column.name: homepage
column.Comment: The comment author’s home page address from the comment form, if user is anonymous, and the ’Anonymous users may/must leave their contact information’ setting is turned on.

column.name: language
column.Comment: The languages.language of this comment.

column.name: cid
column.Comment: The CSS ID this cache object belongs to.

column.name: filename
column.Comment: The filename this CSS is stored in.

column.name: css
column.Comment: CSS being stored.

column.name: filter
column.Comment: Whether or not this CSS needs to be filtered.

column.name: sid
column.Comment: The session ID this cache object belongs to.

column.name: name
column.Comment: The name of the object this cache is attached to.

column.name: obj
column.Comment: The type of the object this cache is attached to; this essentially represents the owner so that several sub-systems can use this cache.

column.name: updated
column.Comment: The time this cache was created or updated.

column.name: data
column.Comment: Serialized data being stored.

column.name: format
column.Comment: The date format string.

column.name: type
column.Comment: The date format type, e.g. medium.

column.name: language
column.Comment: A languages.language for this format to be used with.

column.name: type
column.Comment: The date format type, e.g. medium.

column.name: title
column.Comment: The human readable name of the format type.

column.name: locked
column.Comment: Whether or not this is a system provided format.

column.name: dfid
column.Comment: The date format identifier.

column.name: format
column.Comment: The date format string.

column.name: type
column.Comment: The date format type, e.g. medium.

column.name: locked
column.Comment: Whether or not this format can be modified.

column.name: id
column.Comment: The primary identifier for a field

column.name: field_name
column.Comment: The name of this field. Non-deleted field names are unique, but multiple deleted fields can have the same name.

column.name: type
column.Comment: The type of this field.

column.name: module
column.Comment: The module that implements the field type.

column.name: active
column.Comment: Boolean indicating whether the module that implements the field type is enabled.

column.name: storage_type
column.Comment: The storage backend for the field.

column.name: storage_module
column.Comment: The module that implements the storage backend.

column.name: storage_active
column.Comment: Boolean indicating whether the module that implements the storage backend is enabled.

column.name: locked
column.Comment: @TODO

column.name: data
column.Comment: Serialized data containing the field properties that do not warrant a dedicated column.

column.name: id
column.Comment: The primary identifier for a field instance

column.name: field_id
column.Comment: The identifier of the field attached by this instance

column.name: entity_type
column.Comment: The entity type this data is attached to

column.name: bundle
column.Comment: The field instance bundle to which this row belongs, used when deleting a field instance

column.name: deleted
column.Comment: A boolean indicating whether this data item has been deleted

column.name: entity_id
column.Comment: The entity id this data is attached to

column.name: revision_id
column.Comment: The entity revision id this data is attached to, or NULL if the entity type is not versioned

column.name: language
column.Comment: The language for this data item.

column.name: delta
column.Comment: The sequence number for this data item, used for multi-value fields

column.Comment: The entity type this data is attached to

column.Comment: The entity id this data is attached to

column.name: revision_id
column.Comment: The entity revision id this data is attached to

column.name: language
column.Comment: The language for this data item.

column.name: delta
column.Comment: The sequence number for this data item, used for multi-value fields

key.name: PRIMARY
key.ColNames: entity_type entity_id revision_id deleted delta language

column.name: fid
column.Comment: File ID.

column.name: uid
column.Comment: The users.uid of the user who is associated with the file.

column.name: filename
column.Comment: Name of the file with no path components. This may differ from the basename of the URI if the file is renamed to avoid overwriting an existing file.

column.name: uri
column.Comment: The URI to access the file (either local or remote).

column.name: filemime
column.Comment: The file’s MIME type.

column.name: filesize
column.Comment: The size of the file in bytes.

column.name: status
column.Comment: A field indicating the status of the file. Two status are defined in core: temporary (0) and permanent (1). Temporary files older than DRUPAL_MAXIMUM_TEMP_FILE_AGE will be removed during a cron run.

column.name: timestamp
column.Comment: UNIX timestamp for when the file was added.

column.name: fid
column.Comment: File ID.

column.name: module
column.Comment: The name of the module that is using the file.

column.name: type
column.Comment: The name of the object type in which the file is used.

column.name: id
column.Comment: The primary key of the object using the file.

column.name: count
column.Comment: The number of times this file is used by this object.

column.name: format
column.Comment: Foreign key: The filter_format.format to which this filter is assigned.

column.name: module
column.Comment: The origin module of the filter.

column.name: name
column.Comment: Name of the filter being referenced.

column.name: weight
column.Comment: Weight of filter within format.

column.name: status
column.Comment: Filter enabled status. (1 = enabled, 0 = disabled)

column.name: settings
column.Comment: A serialized array of name value pairs that store the filter settings for the specific format.

column.name: format
column.Comment: Primary Key: Unique machine name of the format.

column.name: name
column.Comment: Name of the text format (Filtered HTML).

column.name: cache
column.Comment: Flag to indicate whether format is cacheable. (1 = cacheable, 0 = not cacheable)

column.name: status
column.Comment: The status of the text format. (1 = enabled, 0 = disabled)

column.name: weight
column.Comment: Weight of text format to use when listing.

column.name: fid
column.Comment: Unique flood event ID.

column.name: event
column.Comment: Name of event (e.g. contact).

column.name: identifier
column.Comment: Identifier of the visitor, such as an IP address or hostname.

column.name: timestamp
column.Comment: Timestamp of the event.

column.name: expiration
column.Comment: Expiration timestamp. Expired events are purged on cron run.

column.name: uid
column.Comment: The users.uid that read the node nid.

column.name: nid
column.Comment: The node.nid that was read.

column.name: timestamp
column.Comment: The Unix timestamp at which the read occurred.

column.name: ieid
column.Comment: The primary identifier for an image effect.

column.name: isid
column.Comment: The image_styles.isid for an image style.

column.name: weight
column.Comment: The weight of the effect in the style.

column.name: name
column.Comment: The unique name of the effect to be executed.

column.name: data
column.Comment: The configuration data for the effect.

column.name: isid
column.Comment: The primary identifier for an image style.

column.name: name
column.Comment: The style machine name.

column.name: label
column.Comment: The style administrative name.

column.name: menu_name
column.Comment: Primary Key: Unique key for menu. This is used as a block delta so length is 32.

column.name: title
column.Comment: Menu title; displayed at top of block.

column.name: description
column.Comment: Menu description.

column.name: menu_name
column.Comment: The menu name. All links with the same menu name (such as ’navigation’) are part of the same menu.

column.name: mlid
column.Comment: The menu link ID (mlid) is the integer primary key.

column.name: plid
column.Comment: The parent link ID (plid) is the mlid of the link above in the hierarchy, or zero if the link is at the top level in its menu.

column.name: link_path
column.Comment: The Drupal path or external path this link points to.

column.name: router_path
column.Comment: For links corresponding to a Drupal path (external = 0), this connects the link to a menu_router.path for joins.

column.name: link_title
column.Comment: The text displayed for the link, which may be modified by a title callback stored in menu_router.

column.name: options
column.Comment: A serialized array of options to be passed to the url() or l() function, such as a query string or HTML attributes.

column.name: module
column.Comment: The name of the module that generated this link.

column.name: hidden
column.Comment: A flag for whether the link should be rendered in menus. (1 = a disabled menu item that may be shown on admin screens, -1 = a menu callback, 0 = a normal, visible link)

column.name: external
column.Comment: A flag to indicate if the link points to a full URL starting with a protocol, like http:// (1 = external, 0 = internal).

column.name: has_children
column.Comment: Flag indicating whether any links have this link as a parent (1 = children exist, 0 = no children).

column.name: expanded
column.Comment: Flag for whether this link should be rendered as expanded in menus - expanded links always have their child links displayed, instead of only when the link is in the active trail (1 = expanded, 0 = not expanded)

column.name: weight
column.Comment: Link weight among links in the same menu at the same depth.

column.name: depth
column.Comment: The depth relative to the top level. A link with plid == 0 will have depth == 1.

column.name: customized
column.Comment: A flag to indicate that the user has manually created or edited the link (1 = customized, 0 = not customized).

column.name: p1
column.Comment: The first mlid in the materialized path. If N = depth, then pN must equal the mlid. If depth > 1 then p(N-1) must equal the plid. All pX where X > depth must equal zero. The columns p1 .. p9 are also called the parents.

column.name: p2
column.Comment: The second mlid in the materialized path. See p1.

column.name: p3
column.Comment: The third mlid in the materialized path. See p1.

column.name: p4
column.Comment: The fourth mlid in the materialized path. See p1.

column.name: p5
column.Comment: The fifth mlid in the materialized path. See p1.

column.name: p6
column.Comment: The sixth mlid in the materialized path. See p1.

column.name: p7
column.Comment: The seventh mlid in the materialized path. See p1.

column.name: p8
column.Comment: The eighth mlid in the materialized path. See p1.

column.name: p9
column.Comment: The ninth mlid in the materialized path. See p1.

column.name: updated
column.Comment: Flag that indicates that this link was generated during the update from Drupal 5.

index.name: menu_parents
index.ColNames: menu_name p1 p2 p3 p4 p5 p6 p7 p8 p9

column.name: path
column.Comment: Primary Key: the Drupal path this entry describes

column.name: load_functions
column.Comment: A serialized array of function names (like node_load) to be called to load an object corresponding to a part of the current path.

column.name: to_arg_functions
column.Comment: A serialized array of function names (like user_uid_optional_to_arg) to be called to replace a part of the router path with another string.

column.name: access_callback
column.Comment: The callback which determines the access to this router path. Defaults to user_access.

column.name: access_arguments
column.Comment: A serialized array of arguments for the access callback.

column.name: page_callback
column.Comment: The name of the function that renders the page.

column.name: page_arguments
column.Comment: A serialized array of arguments for the page callback.

column.name: delivery_callback
column.Comment: The name of the function that sends the result of the page_callback function to the browser.

column.name: fit
column.Comment: A numeric representation of how specific the path is.

column.name: number_parts
column.Comment: Number of parts in this router path.

column.name: context
column.Comment: Only for local tasks (tabs) - the context of a local task to control its placement.

column.name: tab_parent
column.Comment: Only for local tasks (tabs) - the router path of the parent page (which may also be a local task).

column.name: tab_root
column.Comment: Router path of the closest non-tab parent page. For pages that are not local tasks, this will be the same as the path.

column.name: title
column.Comment: The title for the current page, or the title for the tab if this is a local task.

column.name: title_callback
column.Comment: A function which will alter the title. Defaults to t()

column.name: title_arguments
column.Comment: A serialized array of arguments for the title callback. If empty, the title will be used as the sole argument for the title callback.

column.name: theme_callback
column.Comment: A function which returns the name of the theme that will be used to render this page. If left empty, the default theme will be used.

column.name: theme_arguments
column.Comment: A serialized array of arguments for the theme callback.

column.name: type
column.Comment: Numeric representation of the type of the menu item, like MENU_LOCAL_TASK.

column.name: description
column.Comment: A description of this item.

column.name: position
column.Comment: The position of the block (left or right) on the system administration page for this item.

column.name: weight
column.Comment: Weight of the element. Lighter weights are higher up, heavier weights go down.

column.name: include_file
column.Comment: The file to include for this element, usually the page callback function lives in this file.

column.name: nid
column.Comment: The primary identifier for a node.

column.name: vid
column.Comment: The current node_revision.vid version identifier.

column.name: type
column.Comment: The node_type.type of this node.

column.name: language
column.Comment: The languages.language of this node.

column.name: title
column.Comment: The title of this node, always treated as non-markup plain text.

column.name: uid
column.Comment: The users.uid that owns this node; initially, this is the user that created it.

column.name: status
column.Comment: Boolean indicating whether the node is published (visible to non-administrators).

column.name: created
column.Comment: The Unix timestamp when the node was created.

column.name: changed
column.Comment: The Unix timestamp when the node was most recently saved.

column.name: comment
column.Comment: Whether comments are allowed on this node: 0 = no, 1 = closed (read only), 2 = open (read/write).

column.name: promote
column.Comment: Boolean indicating whether the node should be displayed on the front page.

column.name: sticky
column.Comment: Boolean indicating whether the node should be displayed at the top of lists in which it appears.

column.name: tnid
column.Comment: The translation set id for this node, which equals the node id of the source post in each set.

column.name: translate
column.Comment: A boolean indicating whether this translation page needs to be updated.

column.name: nid
column.Comment: The node.nid this record affects.

column.name: gid
column.Comment: The grant ID a user must possess in the specified realm to gain this row’s privileges on the node.

column.name: realm
column.Comment: The realm in which the user must possess the grant ID. Each node access node can define one or more realms.

column.name: grant_view
column.Comment: Boolean indicating whether a user with the realm/grant pair can view this node.

column.name: grant_update
column.Comment: Boolean indicating whether a user with the realm/grant pair can edit this node.

column.name: grant_delete
column.Comment: Boolean indicating whether a user with the realm/grant pair can delete this node.

column.name: nid
column.Comment: The node.nid for which the statistics are compiled.

column.name: cid
column.Comment: The comment.cid of the last comment.

column.name: last_comment_timestamp
column.Comment: The Unix timestamp of the last comment that was posted within this node, from comment.changed.

column.name: last_comment_name
column.Comment: The name of the latest author to post a comment on this node, from comment.name.

column.name: last_comment_uid
column.Comment: The user ID of the latest author to post a comment on this node, from comment.uid.

column.name: comment_count
column.Comment: The total number of comments on this node.

column.name: nid
column.Comment: The node this version belongs to.

column.name: vid
column.Comment: The primary identifier for this version.

column.name: uid
column.Comment: The users.uid that created this version.

column.name: title
column.Comment: The title of this version.

column.name: log
column.Comment: The log entry explaining the changes in this version.

column.name: timestamp
column.Comment: A Unix timestamp indicating when this version was created.

column.name: status
column.Comment: Boolean indicating whether the node (at the time of this revision) is published (visible to non-administrators).

column.name: comment
column.Comment: Whether comments are allowed on this node (at the time of this revision): 0 = no, 1 = closed (read only), 2 = open (read/write).

column.name: promote
column.Comment: Boolean indicating whether the node (at the time of this revision) should be displayed on the front page.

column.name: sticky
column.Comment: Boolean indicating whether the node (at the time of this revision) should be displayed at the top of lists in which it appears.

column.name: type
column.Comment: The machine-readable name of this type.

column.name: name
column.Comment: The human-readable name of this type.

column.name: base
column.Comment: The base string used to construct callbacks corresponding to this node type.

column.name: module
column.Comment: The module defining this node type.

column.name: description
column.Comment: A brief description of this type.

column.name: help
column.Comment: Help information shown to the user when creating a node of this type.

column.name: has_title
column.Comment: Boolean indicating whether this type uses the node.title field.

column.name: title_label
column.Comment: The label displayed for the title field on the edit form.

column.name: custom
column.Comment: A boolean indicating whether this type is defined by a module (FALSE) or by a user via Add content type (TRUE).

column.name: modified
column.Comment: A boolean indicating whether this type has been modified by an administrator; currently not used in any way.

column.name: locked
column.Comment: A boolean indicating whether the administrator can change the machine name of this type.

column.name: disabled
column.Comment: A boolean indicating whether the node type is disabled.

column.name: orig_type
column.Comment: The original machine-readable name of this node type. This may be different from the current type name if the locked field is 0.

column.name: item_id
column.Comment: Primary Key: Unique item ID.

column.name: name
column.Comment: The queue name.

column.name: data
column.Comment: The arbitrary data for the item.

column.name: expire
column.Comment: Timestamp when the claim lease expires on the item.

column.name: created
column.Comment: Timestamp when the item was created.

column.name: type
column.Comment: The name of the entity type a mapping applies to (node, user, comment, etc.).

column.name: bundle
column.Comment: The name of the bundle a mapping applies to.

column.name: mapping
column.Comment: The serialized mapping of the bundle type and fields to RDF terms.

column.name: name
column.Comment: The name of the function, class, or interface.

column.name: type
column.Comment: Either function or class or interface.

column.name: filename
column.Comment: Name of the file.

column.name: module
column.Comment: Name of the module the file belongs to.

column.name: weight
column.Comment: The order in which this module’s hooks should be invoked relative to other modules. Equal-weighted modules are ordered by name.

column.name: filename
column.Comment: Path to the file.

column.name: hash
column.Comment: sha-256 hash of the file’s contents when last parsed.

column.name: rid
column.Comment: Primary Key: Unique role ID.

column.name: name
column.Comment: Unique role name.

column.name: weight
column.Comment: The weight of this role in listings and the user interface.

column.name: rid
column.Comment: Foreign Key: role.rid.

column.name: permission
column.Comment: A single permission granted to the role identified by rid.

column.name: module
column.Comment: The module declaring the permission.

column.name: sid
column.Comment: Search item ID, e.g. node ID for nodes.

column.name: type
column.Comment: Type of item, e.g. node.

column.name: data
column.Comment: List of space-separated words from the item.

column.name: reindex
column.Comment: Set to force node reindexing.

column.name: word
column.Comment: The search_total.word that is associated with the search item.

column.name: sid
column.Comment: The search_dataset.sid of the searchable item to which the word belongs.

column.name: type
column.Comment: The search_dataset.type of the searchable item to which the word belongs.

column.name: score
column.Comment: The numeric score of the word, higher being more important.

column.name: sid
column.Comment: The search_dataset.sid of the searchable item containing the link to the node.

column.name: type
column.Comment: The search_dataset.type of the searchable item containing the link to the node.

column.name: nid
column.Comment: The node.nid that this item links to.

column.name: caption
column.Comment: The text used to link to the node.nid.

column.name: word
column.Comment: Primary Key: Unique word in the search index.

column.name: count
column.Comment: The count of the word in the index using Zipf’s law to equalize the probability distribution.

column.name: name
column.Comment: Primary Key: Unique name.

column.name: value
column.Comment: A value for the semaphore.

column.name: expire
column.Comment: A Unix timestamp with microseconds indicating when the semaphore should expire.

column.name: value
column.Comment: The value of the sequence.

column.name: uid
column.Comment: The users.uid corresponding to a session, or 0 for anonymous user.

column.name: sid
column.Comment: A session ID. The value is generated by Drupal’s session handlers.

column.name: ssid
column.Comment: Secure session ID. The value is generated by Drupal’s session handlers.

column.name: hostname
column.Comment: The IP address that last used this session ID (sid).

column.name: timestamp
column.Comment: The Unix timestamp when this session last requested a page. Old records are purged by PHP automatically.

column.name: cache
column.Comment: The time of this user’s last post. This is used when the site has specified a minimum_cache_lifetime. See cache_get().

column.name: session
column.Comment: The serialized contents of $_SESSION, an array of name/value pairs that persists across page requests by this session ID. Drupal loads $_SESSION from here at the start of each request and saves it at the end.

column.name: set_name
column.Comment: Primary Key: The menu_links.menu_name under which the set’s links are stored.

column.name: title
column.Comment: The title of the set.

column.name: uid
column.Comment: The users.uid for this set.

column.name: set_name
column.Comment: The shortcut_set.set_name that will be displayed for this user.

column.name: filename
column.Comment: The path of the primary file for this item, relative to the Drupal root; e.g. modules/node/node.module.

column.name: name
column.Comment: The name of the item; e.g. node.

column.name: type
column.Comment: The type of the item, either module, theme, or theme_engine.

column.name: owner
column.Comment: A theme’s ’parent’ . Can be either a theme or an engine.

column.name: status
column.Comment: Boolean indicating whether or not this item is enabled.

column.name: bootstrap
column.Comment: Boolean indicating whether this module is loaded during Drupal’s early bootstrapping phase (e.g. even before the page cache is consulted).

column.name: schema_version
column.Comment: The module’s database schema version number. -1 if the module is not installed (its tables do not exist); 0 or the largest N of the module’s hook_update_N() function that has either been run or existed when the module was first installed.

column.name: weight
column.Comment: The order in which this module’s hooks should be invoked relative to other modules. Equal-weighted modules are ordered by name.

column.name: info
column.Comment: A serialized array containing information from the module’s .info file; keys can include name, description, package, version, core, dependencies, and php.

column.name: nid
column.Comment: The node.nid this record tracks.

column.name: tid
column.Comment: The term ID.

column.name: sticky
column.Comment: Boolean indicating whether the node is sticky.

column.name: created
column.Comment: The Unix timestamp when the node was created.

column.name: tid
column.Comment: Primary Key: Unique term ID.

column.name: vid
column.Comment: The taxonomy_vocabulary.vid of the vocabulary to which the term is assigned.

column.name: name
column.Comment: The term name.

column.name: description
column.Comment: A description of the term.

column.name: format
column.Comment: The filter_format.format of the description.

column.name: weight
column.Comment: The weight of this term in relation to other terms.

column.name: tid
column.Comment: Primary Key: The taxonomy_term_data.tid of the term.

column.name: parent
column.Comment: Primary Key: The taxonomy_term_data.tid of the term’s parent. 0 indicates no parent.

column.name: vid
column.Comment: Primary Key: Unique vocabulary ID.

column.name: name
column.Comment: Name of the vocabulary.

column.name: machine_name
column.Comment: The vocabulary machine name.

column.name: description
column.Comment: Description of the vocabulary.

column.name: hierarchy
column.Comment: The type of hierarchy allowed within the vocabulary. (0 = disabled, 1 = single, 2 = multiple)

column.name: module
column.Comment: The module which created the vocabulary.

column.name: weight
column.Comment: The weight of this vocabulary in relation to other vocabularies.

column.name: pid
column.Comment: A unique path alias identifier.

column.name: source
column.Comment: The Drupal path this alias is for; e.g. node/12.

column.name: alias
column.Comment: The alias for this path; e.g. title-of-the-story.

column.name: language
column.Comment: The language this alias is for; if ’und’, the alias will be used for unknown languages. Each Drupal path can have an alias for each supported language.

column.name: uid
column.Comment: Primary Key: Unique user ID.

column.name: name
column.Comment: Unique user name.

column.name: pass
column.Comment: User’s password (hashed).

column.name: mail
column.Comment: User’s e-mail address.

column.name: theme
column.Comment: User’s default theme.

column.name: signature
column.Comment: User’s signature.

column.name: signature_format
column.Comment: The filter_format.format of the signature.

column.name: created
column.Comment: Timestamp for when user was created.

column.name: access
column.Comment: Timestamp for previous time user accessed the site.

column.name: login
column.Comment: Timestamp for user’s last login.

column.name: status
column.Comment: Whether the user is active(1) or blocked(0).

column.name: timezone
column.Comment: User’s time zone.

column.name: language
column.Comment: User’s default language.

column.name: picture
column.Comment: Foreign key: file_managed.fid of user’s picture.

column.name: init
column.Comment: E-mail address used for initial account creation.

column.name: data
column.Comment: A serialized array of name value pairs that are related to the user. Any form values posted during user edit are stored and are loaded into the $user object during user_load(). Use of this field is discouraged and it will likely disappear in a future...

column.name: uid
column.Comment: Primary Key: users.uid for user.

column.name: rid
column.Comment: Primary Key: role.rid for role.

column.name: name
column.Comment: The name of the variable.

column.name: value
column.Comment: The value of the variable.

column.name: vid
column.Comment: The view this display is attached to.

column.name: id
column.Comment: An identifier for this display; usually generated from the display_plugin, so should be something like page or page_1 or block_2, etc.

column.name: display_title
column.Comment: The title of the display, viewable by the administrator.

column.name: display_plugin
column.Comment: The type of the display. Usually page, block or embed, but is pluggable so may be other things.

column.name: position
column.Comment: The order in which this display is loaded.

column.name: display_options
column.Comment: A serialized array of options for this display; it contains options that are generally only pertinent to that display plugin type.

column.name: vid
column.Comment: The view ID of the field, defined by the database.

column.name: name
column.Comment: The unique name of the view. This is the primary field views are loaded from, and is used so that views may be internal and not necessarily in the database. May only be alphanumeric characters plus underscores.

column.name: description
column.Comment: A description of the view for the admin interface.

column.name: tag
column.Comment: A tag used to group/sort views in the admin interface

column.name: base_table
column.Comment: What table this view is based on, such as node, user, comment, or term.

column.name: human_name
column.Comment: A human readable name used to be displayed in the admin interface

column.name: core
column.Comment: Stores the drupal core version of the view.

column.name: wid
column.Comment: Primary Key: Unique watchdog event ID.

column.name: uid
column.Comment: The users.uid of the user who triggered the event.

column.name: type
column.Comment: Type of log message, for example "user" or "page not found."

column.name: message
column.Comment: Text of log message to be passed into the t() function.

column.name: variables
column.Comment: Serialized array of variables that match the message string and that is passed into the t() function.

column.name: severity
column.Comment: The severity level of the event; ranges from 0 (Emergency) to 7 (Debug)

column.name: link
column.Comment: Link to view the result of the event.

column.name: location
column.Comment: URL of the origin of the event.

column.name: referer
column.Comment: URL of referring page.

column.name: hostname
column.Comment: Hostname of the user who triggered the event.

column.name: timestamp
column.Comment: Unix timestamp of when event occurred.
